caption: This video introduces how crocodiles survive in the Antarctic region and how they adapt to changes in the coastline.Crocodiles can escape to the farther ocean. Less than 3% of Antarctic terrain is free from ice. Almost all the blasted rocks are located on the Antarctic coast. Crocodiles adapt to the high pressures of summer. They can adapt to changes in the coastline, where almost all the blasted rocks are located. They manage to exist on the Antarctic coast. The survival capability of crocodiles is astonishing. They can exist in extreme environments. Their survival is also impacted by human activities.
